persons.name: SigmundZois
persons.description: Wealthy mining magnate in what is now Slovenia. A influential intellectual  and keen amateur mineralogist.

places.name: Trieste
places.description: Trieste is the capital city of the Friuli Venezia Giulia region in north-east Italy. A port city, it occupies a thin strip of land between the Adriatic coast and Slovenia’s border on the limestone-dominated Karst Plateau.

places.name: Ljubljana
places.description: Also known as Laybach or Laibach. Ljubljana is the capital city of Slovenia.

places.name: Regensburg
places.description: Also known as Ratisbon. Regensburg is a city in Bavaria at the confluence of the Danube, Naab, and Regen rivers.

places.name: River Danube
places.description: The Danube is the second longest river in Europe. It flows through central and south eastern Europe into the Black Sea.

places.name: Vienna
places.description: Austria’s capital, lies in the country’s east on the Danube River.

places.name: Passau
places.description: Passau, a German city on the Austrian border, lies at the confluence of the Danube, Inn, and Ilz Rivers. Known as the Three Rivers City, it is overlooked by the Veste Oberhaus, a 13th-century hilltop fortress.

places.name: River Danube
places.description: The Danube is the second longest river in Europe. It flows through central and south eastern Europe into the Black Sea.

persons.name: Daniel GabrielFahrenheit
persons.description: German physicist, inventor, and scientific instrument maker, who invented the mercury-in-glass thermometer. The temperature scale he proposed is named after him. ForMemRSL.

persons.name: BenjaminThompson
persons.description: Born in Massachusetts, he served in the British and Bavarian armies. Knighted by George III in 1787, the Elector of Bavaria created him Reichsgraf von Rumford of the Holy Roman Empire in 1792. His appointment in the late 1790s as Bavarian ambassador to London created a minor diplomatic incident, during which he helped establish and manage the Royal Institution, in the course of which he appointed Davy to lecture there. Later he married Lavoisier's widow and lived unhappily ever after. FRSL.

places.name: River Danube

places.name: Linz

persons.name: Horace Bénédict deSaussure
persons.description: Genevan geologist, meteorologist, physicist, mountaineer and Alpine expolorer. Often referred to as the founder of Alpinism and modern meteorology.

places.name: Mont Blanc
places.description: Mont Blanc is the highest mountain in the Alps and Western Europe, and the highest mountain in Europe outside the Caucasus Mountains.

persons.name: Jöns JacobBerzelius
persons.description: Swedish chemist. He discovered the chemical elements cerium and selenium, and was the first to isolate silicon, thorium, titanium, and zirconium. A rival of Davy's whom he met a few times.

places.description: The Bovey Formation in Devon contains lignite, a poor brown coal with a visibly woody structure.

persons.name: NickolasEsterhazy
persons.description: Hungarian prince and patron of the arts, especially music. Davy presented him with a copy of Salmonia.

places.name: Lake Neusiedl
places.description: The largest endorheic lake in Central Europe, straddling the Austrian–Hungarian border.

places.name: Hungary

places.name: Kaposvár
places.description: A city with county rights in the southwestern part of Hungary, south of Lake Balaton.

places.name: Solfatara di Pomezia
places.description: Solfatara di Pomezia is part of a nature reserve near Rome, Italy.

places.name: Enns
places.description: A tributary of the Danube River, and once a major iron-ore transport route.

places.name: The Colosseum
places.description: The Colosseum, the largest amphitheatre ever built, is located in the centre of Rome. Now a ruin, its construction began 2,000 years ago.

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

places.name: Campagna
places.description: The Roman Campagna is an area of low-lying countryside surrounding Rome, where both the Tiber and Aniene Rivers flow.

places.name: Pompeii
places.description: An ancient city located in what is now the comune of Pompei near Naples in the Campania region of Italy. Pompeii was buried in volcanic ash in the Eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 CE.

places.name: Apennines
places.description: The Apennines are a range of mountains that run down the spine of peninsular Italy.

places.name: Naples
places.description: Naples is the regional capital of Campania in Italy. It is located beneath the volcano, Vesuvius.

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

places.name: Caspian sea
places.description: The world's largest inland body of water, often described as the world's largest lake or a full-fledged sea.

places.name: River Danube
places.description: The Danube is the second longest river in Europe. It flows through central and south eastern Europe into the Black Sea.

places.name: Hungary
places.description: a landlocked country in Central Europe. Its capital, Budapest, is bisected by the Danube River.

places.name: Celano
places.description: A town and comune in the Province of L'Aquila, central Italy.

places.name: Bay of Naples
places.description: The Bay (or Gulf) of Naples is located on the south-western coast of Italy, with Naples to the north, Vesuvius to the east, and the Sorrento Peninsula to the south.

places.name: Land's End
places.description: A headland in western Cornwall, the most westerly point of mainland England.

places.name: Rhine
places.description: The Rhine is one of Europe's major rivers. It rises in Switzerland, flows through Germany, and enters the North Sea in the Netherlands.

places.name: Lake Como
places.description: A lake of glacial origin in Lombardy, Italy.

places.name: Africa
places.description: The world's second-largest and second-most populous continent.

places.name: Mediterranean Sea
places.description: Connected to the Atlantic Ocean and almost completely surrounded by land.

places.name: Lakes of Killarney
places.description: Three lakes (Lough Leane, Muckross Lake - also called Middle Lake, and Upper Lake) surrounded by the MacGillycuddy's Reeks and now part of Killarney National Park.

places.name: Niger
places.description: The main river of West Africa, extending about 4,180 km.

places.name: Hungary
places.description: The North Hungarian Mountains stretch along the north-easten border of Hungary.

places.name: Canigou
places.description: A mountain peak located in the Pyrenees of southern France. Davy made sketches and wrote a poem about The Canigou in notebook 14I.

places.name: Flanders' Rhine
places.description: This is possibly the complex river delta that in corporates the Scheldt and Hollands Diep (the estuary of the Rhine and Meusse Rivers).

places.name: Po Valley
places.description: A vast plain area in Northern Italy, featuring the Po River.

places.name: Mount Vesuvius

places.name: Pyrénées-Orientales
